decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the following drawings and document title number(s): 1025-SA-PL-01 (St Ann's School Location Plan); 1025-SA-PL-02 (St Ann's School Block Plan and Existing Site Plan); 1025-SA-PL-03 (St Ann's School Proposed Site Plan); 1025-SA-PL-04 (St Ann's School Existing Site Plan Enlargement); 1025-SA-PL-05 (St Ann's School Proposed Site Plan Enlargement); 1025-SA-PL-06 (St Ann's School Existing and Proposed Elevations); 1025-SA-PL-07 (St Ann's School Proposed Acoustic Treatment Detail); 1025-SA-PL-08 (ASHP Acoustic Enclosure); PL05-01 (Design and Access Statement); REPORT No. 2308058-8/03_v3 (Environmental Noise Survey & Noise Impact Assessment Report); Supporting Document "Energy Technologies Hercules 42 EVI DC Air Source High Temperature Heat Pump"; Supporting Document "VirtuHOT Specification Sheet 2020_v1".
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.
| All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building, unless otherwise stated in the submitted application form or approved drawings.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023).

| The individual and combined external sound level emitted from plant, machinery or equipment at the development site shall not exceed the maximum noise rating levels predicted by NOICO in their report ref. 2308058-8/03_v3, dated 1 March 2024, at the nearest and most affected noise sensitive premises at the development site and at surrounding premises, with noise mitigation measures according to details in Section 8 of the report, and as assessed in accordance with BS4142:2014 +A1 2019, with all machinery operating together at maximum capacity.

Reason:  To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise from mechanical installations/ equipment, in accordance with Policy D14 of the London Plan (2021), Policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and Policy DAA of Ealing's draft new Local Plan (Regulation 19).

| Prior to use, machinery, plant and equipment/ extraction/ ventilation system and ducting at the development shall be mounted with proprietary anti-vibration isolators and fan motors shall be vibration isolated from the casing and adequately silenced and maintained as such.

Reason:  To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by vibration noise from mechanical installations/ equipment, in accordance with Policy D14 of the London Plan (2021), Policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and Policy DAA of Ealing's draft new Local Plan (Regulation 19).
description: Installation of two air source heat pumps and buffer vessel within existing storage enclosure and solar thermal array on flat roof (Regulation 3 Application by London Borough of Ealing)
